meta.dc:subject: legislation
meta.dc:rights: the Government of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region

longTitle.name: longTitle
longTitle.content: An Ordinance to provide for the election of the Chief Executive, and the constitution of the Election Committee, in accordance with Annex I to the Basic Law of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region; to provide for the establishment of the Candidate Eligibility Review Committee; and to provide for related matters.

section.name: s1
section.heading: Short title

subsection.content: This Ordinance may be cited as the Chief Executive Election Ordinance.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Interpretation

subsection.leadIn: In this Ordinance, unless the context otherwise requires—
subsection.def: Acting Chief Executive (署理行政長官) means any public officer assuming the duties of the Chief Executive pursuant to Article 53 of the Basic Law;
Candidate Eligibility Review Committee (候選人資格審查委員會) means the Candidate Eligibility Review Committee established under section 9A; (Added 14 of 2021 s. 389)
Chief Executive (行政長官) means the Chief Executive of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region;
Court (原訟法庭) means the Court of First Instance;
election (選舉) means an election held under section 6;
Election Committee (選舉委員會) means the Election Committee constituted under section 8;
election petition (選舉呈請、選舉呈請書) means an election petition lodged under section 33(1);

def.name: ElectoralOfficer
def.leadIn: electoral officer (選舉事務人員) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Returning Officer;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Chief Electoral Officer;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: an Assistant Returning Officer appointed under section 41(3);

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the Electoral Registration Officer appointed under section 44 of the Schedule;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: an Assistant Electoral Registration Officer appointed under section 44 of the Schedule;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: a Revising Officer appointed under section 46 of the Schedule;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: a Returning Officer appointed under section 47 of the Schedule;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: an Assistant Returning Officer appointed under section 47 of the Schedule; or

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: any other person who is appointed under this Ordinance or the Electoral Affairs Commission Ordinance (Cap. 541) to perform functions at or in connection with an election or a subsector election;

subsection.def: final register of members of the Election Committee (選舉委員會正式委員登記冊) means the register published under section 40(2), (3), (3A) or (4) of the Schedule; (Amended 10 of 2006 s. 20)
function (職能) includes a power and a duty;
poll (投票) means a poll conducted under section 23 or 24; (Amended 10 of 2006 s. 7)
polling date (投票日) means the date fixed in accordance with section 10 or 11 as the date of the poll at an election;

def.name: PrescribedPublicOfficer
def.leadIn: prescribed public officer (訂明公職人員) means any of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Chairman of the Public Service Commission;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Commissioner and Deputy Commissioner of the Independent Commission Against Corruption and the holder of any other office under the Independent Commission Against Corruption Ordinance (Cap. 204);

paragraph.name: c
d
paragraph.content: a member of the Electoral Affairs Commission;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the Chief Executive of the Hong Kong Monetary Authority and any member of the senior management of that Authority, including divisional heads, executive directors, managers and counsel employed by that Authority;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the Privacy Commissioner for Personal Data and any person employed or engaged by him under the Personal Data (Privacy) Ordinance (Cap. 486);

paragraph.name: g
h

subsection.def: Returning Officer (選舉主任) means the Returning Officer appointed under section 41(1);
Revising Officer (審裁官) has the meaning assigned to it by section 1(1) of the Schedule;
subsector election (界別分組選舉) has the meaning assigned to it by section 1 of the Schedule. (Amended 15 of 2016 s. 22)

subsection.content: Any reference in this Ordinance to the performance of a function includes a reference to the exercise of a power or performance of a duty, as the case may be.

section.name: s2A
section.heading: Effect of inclement weather warning on date and period

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: gale warning (烈風警告) has the same meaning as in the Judicial Proceedings (Adjournment During Gale Warnings) Ordinance (Cap. 62);
inclement weather warning day (惡劣天氣警告日) means a working day on which a gale warning or a rainstorm warning is in force at any time during the ordinary business hours;

def.name: OrdinaryBusinessHours
def.leadIn: ordinary business hours (通常辦公時間) means the hours—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: between 9 a.m. and 5 p.m. on any Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday or Friday (other than a general holiday); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: between 9 a.m. and 12 noon on a Saturday (other than a general holiday) during the period between—

subparagraph.content: the date of publication of a notice under section 3 of the Electoral Procedure (Chief Executive Election) Regulation (Cap. 541 sub. leg. J) in respect of an election; and

the date of publication of the result of the election under this Ordinance or the date of the declaration of the termination of the proceedings for the election under this Ordinance, as may be appropriate;

subsection.def: rainstorm warning (暴雨警告) has the same meaning as in the Judicial Proceedings (Adjournment During Gale Warnings) Ordinance (Cap. 62);

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday or Friday other than a general holiday;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a Saturday (other than a general holiday) during the period between—

subparagraph.content: the date of publication of a notice under section 3 of the Electoral Procedure (Chief Executive Election) Regulation (Cap. 541 sub. leg. J) in respect of an election; and

the date of publication of the result of the election under this Ordinance or the date of the declaration of the termination of the proceedings for the election under this Ordinance, as may be appropriate.

subsection.content: If the last day of the nomination period fixed under section 15 falls on an inclement weather warning day, the nomination period is extended to end on the next working day which is not an inclement weather warning day, following that last day, and that section has effect accordingly.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person is required by section 18 or 31 to do an act within a period; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the last day of the period falls on an inclement weather warning day,

subsection.continued: the period is extended, in relation to the act, to end on the next working day which is not an inclement weather warning day, following the day mentioned in paragraph (b), and that section has effect accordingly.

part.name: P2
part.heading: Term of Office and Election of Chief Executive

section.name: s3
section.heading: Term of office of Chief Executive

subsection.leadIn: The term of office of the Chief Executive shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subject to subsection (1A), be 5 years; and (Amended 4 of 2005 s. 2)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: commence on the date on which he assumes office being the date specified for this purpose by the Central People’s Government in the instrument of appointment.

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn: Where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a vacancy in the office of the Chief Executive arises under section 4(b) or (c) during the term of office of a Chief Executive; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person is appointed by the Central People’s Government as the Chief Executive to fill the vacancy before the expiry of the term of office referred to in paragraph (a),

subsection.continued: the term of office of the Chief Executive referred to in paragraph (b) shall expire upon the expiry of the term of office referred to in paragraph (a). (Added 4 of 2005 s. 2)

subsection.content: No person shall hold the office of the Chief Executive for more than 2 consecutive terms.

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.content: Where the appointment of the Chief Executive falls within subsection (1A)(b), his term of office shall, for the purposes of subsection (2), be regarded as one term. (Added 10 of 2006 s. 3)
The date on which the term of office of the Chief Executive commences shall be published by notice in the Gazette.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Vacancy in office
section.leadIn: The office of the Chief Executive becomes vacant—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on the expiry of the term of office of the Chief Executive;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the Chief Executive dies; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if the Central People’s Government removes the Chief Executive from office in accordance with the Basic Law.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Declaration of vacancy

subsection.content: Where the office of the Chief Executive becomes vacant under section 4(b) or (c), the Acting Chief Executive shall, by notice published in the Gazette, declare the vacancy.

subsection.leadIn: A declaration under subsection (1) shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be made within 21 days after the Acting Chief Executive becomes aware of the vacancy; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: specify the date on which the office became vacant.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Election to return candidate for appointment to fill vacancy in office

subsection.leadIn: An election shall be held in accordance with— (Amended 10 of 2006 s. 4)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Basic Law;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: this Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any other enactment which applies to the election of the Chief Executive,

subsection.continued: to return a candidate for appointment by the Central People’s Government to fill the vacancy in the office of the Chief Executive—

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: that will arise under section 4(a); or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: that arises under section 4(b) or (c).

subsection.leadIn: If, during the period of 6 months before a polling date to be fixed under section 10(1), a vacancy in the office of the Chief Executive arises under section 4(b) or (c)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: sections 10(1) and 11(3)(a) apply to the fixing of the polling date in the election held as a result of the vacancy;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: section 13(d)(i) applies to the eligibility for candidature for the election; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: sections 10(2) and 11(3)(b) do not apply to the election,

subsection.continued: notwithstanding any other provision of this Ordinance. (Added 10 of 2006 s. 4)

section.name: s7
section.heading: Election by Election Committee
section.content: The Chief Executive shall be elected by the Election Committee as prescribed in Annex I to the Basic Law.

section.name: s8
section.heading: Constitution of Election Committee

subsection.content: There shall be constituted a committee, to be known as the Election Committee, for the purposes of this Ordinance and such other purposes as may be prescribed by any other Ordinance.
The Election Committee shall be constituted in accordance with the Schedule. (Amended 10 of 2006 s. 30)

section.name: s9
section.heading: Term of office of Election Committee

subsection.content: The term of office of the Election Committee is as prescribed by Annex I to the Basic Law. (Replaced 14 of 2021 s. 390)
The Election Committee shall be constituted on 1 February in the year in which the term of office of the Chief Executive is to expire. (Added 10 of 2006 s. 5)
Despite subsection (2), for the year of 2021, the Election Committee is to be constituted on 22 October 2021. (Added 14 of 2021 s. 390)
The term of office of the Election Committee constituted on 22 October 2021 ends on 21 October 2026. (Added 14 of 2021 s. 390)

section.name: s9A
section.heading: Establishment of the Candidate Eligibility Review Committee

subsection.content: A Candidate Eligibility Review Committee is established for the purposes of Annexes I and II to the Basic Law, this Ordinance and such other purposes as may be prescribed by any other Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: The Candidate Eligibility Review Committee is to consist of the following members—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the chairperson;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: at least 2 but not more than 4 official members; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: at least 1 but not more than 3 non-official members.

subsection.content: Each member of the Candidate Eligibility Review Committee is to be appointed by the Chief Executive by notice published in the Gazette.

Only a principal official appointed pursuant to a nomination under Article 48(5) of the Basic Law is eligible for appointment under subsection (3) as the chairperson or an official member referred to in subsection (2)(a) or (b).
Only a person who is not a public officer is eligible for appointment under subsection (3) as a non-official member referred to in subsection (2)(c).
The Chief Executive must report any appointment made under subsection (3) to the Central People’s Government for the record.

section.name: s9B
section.heading: No legal proceedings may be instituted in respect of certain decisions made by Candidate Eligibility Review Committee

subsection.content: According to Annex I to the Basic Law, no legal proceedings may be instituted in respect of a decision made by the Candidate Eligibility Review Committee on the eligibility of a candidate for membership of the Election Committee or a candidate for the office of Chief Executive pursuant to the opinion of the Committee for Safeguarding National Security of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region.

subsection.leadIn: In subsection (1)—

def.name: CandidateForMembershipOfTheElectionCommittee
def.leadIn: candidate for membership of the Election Committee (選舉委員候選人) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person proposed to be registered as an ex-officio member in accordance with Part 2A of the Schedule;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person nominated as a nominee in accordance with Part 3 of the Schedule; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a person nominated as a candidate at a subsector election in accordance with Part 4 of the Schedule.

section.name: s10
section.heading: Polling date

subsection.leadIn: Subject to section 11, the date of the poll at an election to return a candidate for appointment to fill the vacancy in the office of the Chief Executive that will arise under section 4(a) shall, where the first day of the period of 95 days expiring at the beginning of the day on which the vacancy will arise—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is a Sunday, be that Sunday; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is not a Sunday, be the Sunday immediately preceding the commencement of that period.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to section 11, the date of the poll at an election to return a candidate for appointment to fill the vacancy in the office of the Chief Executive that arises under section 4(b) or (c) shall, where the 120th day after the date on which the office becomes vacant as specified under section 5(2)(b)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is a Sunday, be that Sunday; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is not a Sunday, be the Sunday immediately following that day.

subsection.content: Nothing in this section or section 11 prevents any round of voting from being conducted on a day after the polling date if the operation of section 27 so requires.

section.name: s11
section.heading: Fixing new polling date under certain circumstances

subsection.leadIn: Where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a polling date is fixed in accordance with this section or section 10; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: no candidate is validly nominated under section 17 at the close of nominations,

subsection.continued: the new polling date shall, where the 42nd day after the close of nominations—

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: is a Sunday, be that Sunday; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: is not a Sunday, be the Sunday immediately following that day.

subsection.leadIn: Where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a polling date is fixed in accordance with this section or section 10; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the proceedings for the election are terminated under section 22(1AA), (1AB), (1) or (3), (Amended 10 of 2006 s. 8; 1 of 2011 s. 3)

subsection.continued: the new polling date shall, where the 42nd day after the termination of the proceedings for the election—

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: is a Sunday, be that Sunday; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: is not a Sunday, be the Sunday immediately following that day.

subsection.leadIn: If the candidate returned at an election for appointment to fill the vacancy in the office of the Chief Executive—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: that will arise under section 4(a) cannot assume the office of the Chief Executive on the day on which the vacancy arises, the new polling date shall, where the 120th day after the expiry of the term of office of the serving Chief Executive—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: is a Sunday, be that Sunday; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: is not a Sunday, be the Sunday immediately following that day;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: that has arisen under section 4(b) or (c) cannot assume the office of the Chief Executive before the expiry of 6 months commencing on the date on which the vacancy arose, the new polling date shall, where the 120th day after the expiry of those 6 months—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: is a Sunday, be that Sunday; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: is not a Sunday, be the Sunday immediately following that day.

subsection.content: Where a new polling date is fixed in accordance with this section, the Chief Electoral Officer shall fix the nomination period accordingly.

section.name: s12
section.heading: Publication of polling date
section.content: A polling date fixed in accordance with section 10 or 11 shall be published by notice in the Gazette.

section.name: s13
section.heading: Eligibility for nomination as candidate
section.leadIn: Subject to section 14, a person is eligible to be nominated as a candidate at an election if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: he is a permanent resident of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: he is a Chinese citizen as defined by section 2 of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region Passports Ordinance (Cap. 539);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: he has no right of abode in any foreign country; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: he—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.leadIn: in the case of an election to fill the vacancy in the office of the Chief Executive that will arise under section 4(a), will have—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: reached 40 years of age on the day on which the vacancy is due to arise; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: ordinarily resided in Hong Kong for a continuous period of not less than 20 years before the day on which the vacancy is due to arise;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.leadIn: in the case of an election to fill the vacancy in the office of the Chief Executive that arises under section 4(b) or (c), will have—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: reached 40 years of age on the polling date; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: ordinarily resided in Hong Kong for a continuous period of not less than 20 years before the polling date.

section.name: s14
section.heading: Disqualification from being nominated

subsection.leadIn: Without prejudice to section 13(1)(c) of the Electoral Affairs Commission Ordinance (Cap. 541), a person is disqualified from being nominated as a candidate if— (Amended 13 of 2021 s. 27)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: he is the Chief Executive and holds the office of the Chief Executive for the second consecutive term;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: he is a prescribed public officer;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: he is adjudged bankrupt under the Bankruptcy Ordinance (Cap. 6) and has not been discharged under section 30A or 30B of that Ordinance;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: he holds a passport or similar travel document other than—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a Hong Kong Special Administrative Region Passport issued under the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region Passports Ordinance (Cap. 539);

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a certificate of identity within the meaning of the Immigration Ordinance (Cap. 115); or

subparagraph.name: iii

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.leadIn: he has, in Hong Kong or any other place, been sentenced to death and has not either—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: served the sentence or undergone such other punishment as a competent authority may have substituted for the sentence; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: received a free pardon;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: he has been convicted of an offence endangering national security; (Amended 6 of 2024 s. 184)

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.leadIn: he has been convicted—

subparagraph.name: i
ii
subparagraph.content: of having engaged in corrupt conduct or illegal conduct in contravention of the Elections (Corrupt and Illegal Conduct) Ordinance (Cap. 554);

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: of an offence against Part II of the Prevention of Bribery Ordinance (Cap. 201); or

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: of any offence prescribed by section 7 of Schedule 4A to the District Councils Ordinance (Cap. 547) or the EAC Regulations made for the purposes of this paragraph, (Amended 19 of 2023 s. 187)

paragraph.continued: within the 5 years before the date of nomination; or

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: he is found for the time being under the Mental Health Ordinance (Cap. 136) to be incapable, by reason of mental incapacity, of managing and administering his property and affairs.

subsection.leadIn: Without prejudice to section 13(1)(c) of the Electoral Affairs Commission Ordinance (Cap. 541), a person is also disqualified from being nominated as a candidate if, within the 5 years before the date of nomination—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.leadIn: the person has been declared or decided in accordance with any law—

subparagraph.content: to be in breach of a specified oath; or

to have failed to fulfil the legal requirements and conditions on upholding the Basic Law and bearing allegiance to the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region of the People’s Republic of China. (Added 13 of 2021 s. 27)

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: specified oath (指明誓言) means an oath taken under the law that the oath-taker will uphold the Basic Law and bear allegiance to the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region of the People’s Republic of China. (Added 13 of 2021 s. 27)

section.name: s15
section.heading: Nomination period

subsection.content: The nomination period for candidature at an election shall be fixed by the Chief Electoral Officer. (Amended 15 of 2016 s. 24)

subsection.leadIn: The nomination period—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shall not be less than 14 days; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: shall terminate on a day earlier than the 21 days before the polling date.

subsection.content: Despite subsection (2), the nomination period may end during the period of 21 days before the polling date if the nomination period is extended under section 2A(2). (Added 15 of 2016 s. 24)

section.name: s16
section.heading: Manner of nomination

subsection.content: A nomination of a candidate shall be made in such form and manner as may be specified in the EAC Regulations made for the purposes of this section.

subsection.leadIn: A nomination of a candidate shall be made—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subject to subsections (4) and (5), by not less than 188 members of the Election Committee (with not less than 15 members of the Election Committee in each of the 5 sectors referred to in section 2(3) and (4) of the Schedule); and (Replaced 14 of 2021 s. 392)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by delivering a duly completed nomination form to the Returning Officer before the close of nominations.

subsection.leadIn: A nomination made by a member of the Election Committee—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shall be signified by his signature on the nomination form; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: shall not be withdrawn or revoked by the member.

subsection.leadIn: The signature of a member of the Election Committee on a nomination form nominating a person is invalid and shall be disregarded for the purposes of subsections (2) and (3) if, at the time of the delivery of the form to the Returning Officer—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a nomination form nominating a person other than the first-mentioned person for the same election and signed by the member has been delivered to the Returning Officer; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person nominated by virtue of the nomination form referred to in paragraph (a) has not withdrawn his candidature under section 19.

subsection.leadIn: If a member of the Election Committee—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: resigns under section 3(3) of the Schedule;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is serving a sentence of imprisonment for the time being;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: falls within paragraph (a), (b), (c), (ca), (f) or (g) of section 18(1) of the Schedule; (Amended 14 of 2021 s. 392; 6 of 2024 s. 185)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: is or has been convicted, within the 5 years before the polling date of an election, in the manner prescribed by subparagraph (i), (ii) or (iii) of section 18(1)(e) of the Schedule; (Amended 14 of 2021 s. 392)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: is in breach of an oath taken under section 42A of the Schedule; or (Added 14 of 2021 s. 392)

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: fails, or is declared or decided in accordance with any law to have failed, to fulfil the legal requirements and conditions on upholding the Basic Law and bearing allegiance to the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region of the People’s Republic of China, (Added 14 of 2021 s. 392)

subsection.continued: he shall be disqualified from making nomination at the election.

subsection.name: 5A
subsection.content: To avoid doubt, if a person’s functions as a member of the Election Committee are suspended under section 43A(2) of the Schedule, the person is disqualified from making nomination at the election. (Added 14 of 2021 s. 392)
The disqualification of a member of the Election Committee from making nomination shall not affect a nomination made by him before such disqualification.

subsection.leadIn: A nomination of a candidate shall be accompanied by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a declaration to the effect that—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: he stands for the election in an individual capacity; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: he will uphold the Basic Law and pledge allegiance to the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a declaration as to his nationality and as to whether he has a right of abode in any foreign country.

subsection.content: The declarations referred to in subsection (7) are not effective unless they are signed by the candidate concerned.

section.name: s17
section.heading: Determination of validity of nomination
section.content: The Candidate Eligibility Review Committee must, as soon as practicable after a nomination form that complies with the EAC Regulations is submitted in accordance with those Regulations, determine whether or not the person nominated by virtue of the nomination form is validly nominated in accordance with Annex I to the Basic Law, this Ordinance and those Regulations as a candidate at the election.

section.name: s18
section.heading: Publication of nomination

subsection.leadIn: The Candidate Eligibility Review Committee must, by notice published in the Gazette, declare— (Amended 14 of 2021 s. 394)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the names of all candidates who are validly nominated; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: together with the name of each of such candidates, the names of those members of the Election Committee nominating him.

subsection.content: A notice under subsection (1) shall be published within 7 days after the date of the close of nominations.

Copies of the nomination forms of all candidates shall be made available for inspection by the public free of charge during ordinary business hours at the office of the Returning Officer until the result of the election is declared under section 28.

section.name: s19
section.heading: Withdrawal of candidature

subsection.content: A candidate may withdraw his candidature at any time before the close of nominations.
The withdrawal of a candidate’s candidature is not effective unless it complies with the EAC Regulations made for the purposes of this section.
A person who is nominated as a candidate shall cease to be regarded as such upon the withdrawal of his candidature.

section.name: s20
section.heading: Disqualification from being elected

subsection.leadIn: If, after the close of nominations but before the close of polling, proof is given to the satisfaction of the Candidate Eligibility Review Committee that— (Amended 14 of 2021 s. 395)

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: a candidate falls within any paragraph (except paragraph (h)) of section 14(1); (Amended 13 of 2021 s. 28)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a candidate is or has been convicted, within the 5 years before the polling date, in the manner prescribed by subparagraph (i), (ii), (iii) or (iv) of section 14(1)(h); (Amended 13 of 2021 s. 28)

paragraph.name: ca
paragraph.content: a candidate falls or has fallen, within the 5 years before the polling date, within any paragraph of section 14(2); or (Added 13 of 2021 s. 28)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the nomination of a candidate does not comply with this Ordinance,

subsection.continued: the Candidate Eligibility Review Committee must, by a public declaration, disqualify the candidate from being elected at the election. (Amended 14 of 2021 s. 395)

subsection.content: A declaration made under subsection (1) shall be published in the Gazette as soon as practicable after it is made.

section.name: s21
section.heading: Postponement or adjournment of polling or counting of votes

subsection.content: The Electoral Affairs Commission may direct the postponement of a poll or the counting of votes in respect of a poll if, before the commencement of polling or counting, as the case may be, the Commission is of the opinion that the polling or counting, as the case may be, is likely to be obstructed, disrupted, undermined or seriously affected by riot or open violence or any danger to public health or safety. (Amended 15 of 2016 s. 55)

subsection.leadIn: The Electoral Affairs Commission may direct—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the adjournment of a poll if, during the polling, the Commission is of the opinion that the poll; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the adjournment of the counting of votes in respect of a poll if, during the counting, the Commission is of the opinion that the counting,

subsection.continued: is likely to be or is being obstructed, disrupted, undermined or seriously affected by riot or open violence or any danger to public health or safety. (Amended 15 of 2016 s. 55)

subsection.content: A member of the Election Committee who has cast a vote at a poll adjourned under subsection (2) is not entitled and shall not be allowed to cast a vote again at the resumed polling.
Subsection (3) ceases to apply if the poll proceeds to another round of voting.

section.name: s22
section.heading: Termination of election proceedings

subsection.name: 1AA
subsection.leadIn: Where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: at the close of nominations only one candidate is validly nominated; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: at any time after the close of nominations but before the declaration of the result of the election—

subparagraph.content: proof is given to the satisfaction of the Returning Officer that the candidate dies; or
proof is given to the satisfaction of the Candidate Eligibility Review Committee that the candidate is disqualified under section 20(1) from being elected, (Replaced 14 of 2021 s. 396)

subsection.continued: the Returning Officer shall, by a public declaration, terminate the proceedings for the election. (Added 10 of 2006 s. 9)

subsection.name: 1AB
subsection.leadIn: Where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: at the close of nominations only one candidate is validly nominated; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a poll is conducted under section 23 and the candidate is, under section 26A(4), not returned at the election,

subsection.continued: the Returning Officer shall—

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: publicly declare that no candidate is returned at the election;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: publish the declaration and the result of the poll in the Gazette; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: by a public declaration, terminate the proceedings for the election. (Added 10 of 2006 s. 9)

subsection.leadIn: Where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: at the close of nominations 2 or more candidates are validly nominated; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: at any time after the close of nominations but before the declaration of the result of the election—

subparagraph.content: proof is given to the satisfaction of the Returning Officer that any candidate dies; or
proof is given to the satisfaction of the Candidate Eligibility Review Committee that any candidate is disqualified under section 20(1) from being elected, (Replaced 14 of 2021 s. 396)

subsection.continued: the Returning Officer shall, by a public declaration, terminate the proceedings for the election.

subsection.content: If a candidate is eliminated at any round of voting under section 27(3)(c) or (4)(c), he shall cease to be regarded as a candidate for the purposes of subsection (1)(b).

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: at the close of nominations 2 or more candidates are validly nominated; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a poll is conducted under section 24 and, under section 27(2A), no candidate is returned at the election,

subsection.continued: the Returning Officer must—

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: publicly declare that no candidate is returned at the election;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: publish the declaration and the result of the poll in the Gazette; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: by a public declaration, terminate the proceedings for the election. (Added 1 of 2011 s. 5)

section.name: s23
section.heading: Polling arrangement where only one candidate is validly nominated
section.content: Where at the close of nominations only one candidate is validly nominated, a poll shall be conducted in accordance with section 26A and the EAC Regulations under the supervision of the Returning Officer.

section.name: s24
section.heading: Polling arrangement for contested election
section.content: Where there are 2 or more candidates in an election, a poll shall be conducted in accordance with section 27 and the EAC Regulations under the supervision of the Returning Officer.

section.name: s25
section.heading: Voting by members of Election Committee

subsection.content: Subject to section 26, only the members of the Election Committee whose names appear on the final register of members of the Election Committee can vote at a poll.
The votes at a poll shall be cast by secret ballot.
At a poll each member of the Election Committee is entitled to cast a single vote in each round of voting.

section.name: s26
section.heading: Disqualification from voting

subsection.leadIn: If a member of the Election Committee whose name appears on the final register of members of the Election Committee— (Amended 14 of 2021 s. 397)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: resigns under section 3(3) of the Schedule; (Amended 7 of 2009 s. 3; 14 of 2021 s. 397)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: falls within paragraph (a), (b), (ca), (f) or (g) of section 18(1) of the Schedule; (Amended 7 of 2009 s. 3; 14 of 2021 s. 397; 6 of 2024 s. 186)

paragraph.name: e
f
paragraph.content: fails, or is declared or decided in accordance with any law to have failed, to fulfil the legal requirements and conditions on upholding the Basic Law and bearing allegiance to the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region of the People’s Republic of China, (Added 14 of 2021 s. 397)

subsection.continued: he shall be disqualified from voting at the poll.

subsection.content: To avoid doubt, if a person’s functions as a member of the Election Committee are suspended under section 43A(2) of the Schedule, the person is disqualified from voting at the poll. (Added 14 of 2021 s. 397)

section.name: s26A
section.heading: System of voting: only one candidate

subsection.content: This section applies to an election in which at the close of nominations only one candidate is validly nominated.
In the poll conducted in the election, the ballot papers shall be so designed as to allow members of the Election Committee to cast either a support vote or a not support vote.
If the number of support votes obtained by the candidate exceeds 750, the candidate is returned at the election. (Amended 1 of 2011 s. 6; 14 of 2021 s. 398)
If the number of support votes obtained by the candidate does not exceed 750, the candidate is not returned at the election and section 22(1AB) applies. (Amended 1 of 2011 s. 6; 14 of 2021 s. 398)

section.name: s27
section.heading: System of voting: contested election

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.content: This section applies to an election in which at the close of nominations 2 or more candidates are validly nominated. (Added 1 of 2011 s. 7)
If a candidate obtains more than 750 votes in any round of voting, the candidate is returned at the election.

subsection.leadIn: Where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: there are 2 candidates in the election; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: 2 candidates remain after the elimination of all other candidates under subsection (3)(c) or (4)(c),

subsection.continued: a single round of voting must be conducted for the 2 candidates.

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.content: If in a round of voting conducted under subsection (2), no candidate obtains more than 750 votes, no candidate is returned at the election and section 22(3) applies. (Added 1 of 2011 s. 7)

subsection.leadIn: Where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: there are 3 or more candidates in the election; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: after the first round of voting—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: only 2 candidates obtain the highest and the same number of valid votes cast; or

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: only one candidate obtains the highest number of valid votes cast but the candidate does not obtain more than 750 votes; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: only one candidate obtains the next highest number of valid votes cast,

subsection.continued: then—

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: all candidates other than the 2 candidates referred to in paragraph (b)(i) or (ii) shall be eliminated; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: subsection (2) applies in relation to those 2 candidates.

subsection.leadIn: Where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: there are 3 or more candidates in the election; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: after the first round of voting—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: 3 or more candidates obtain the highest and the same number of valid votes cast; or

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: only one candidate obtains the highest number of valid votes cast but the candidate does not obtain more than 750 votes; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: 2 or more candidates obtain the next highest and the same number of valid votes cast,

subsection.continued: then—

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: all candidates (if any) other than the candidates referred to in paragraph (b)(i) or (ii) shall be eliminated;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: as many rounds of voting as may be necessary shall be conducted for the candidates referred to in paragraph (b)(i) or (ii) until—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: one of them is returned under subsection (1); or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: subsection (2) applies in relation to any 2 of them; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the foregoing provisions of this subsection apply in relation to any such round of voting as they apply in relation to the first round of voting.

section.name: s28
section.heading: Declaration and publication of result

subsection.leadIn: Where the Returning Officer determines that the only candidate nominated at an election is, under section 26A(3), returned at the election, the Returning Officer shall, as soon as practicable after the determination—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: publicly declare that the candidate is elected; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: publish the result of the election in the Gazette. (Added 10 of 2006 s. 14)

subsection.leadIn: As soon as practicable after determining which candidate is returned at an election in which there are 2 or more candidates, the Returning Officer shall— (Amended 10 of 2006 s. 14)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: publicly declare as elected the candidate who is returned at the election; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: publish the result of the election in the Gazette.

section.name: s29
section.heading: Winning candidate presumed to be duly elected
section.content: A person declared under section 28 as elected at an election is presumed to be duly elected until he is ruled by the Court or the Court of Final Appeal pursuant to the determination of an election petition or otherwise as not duly elected.

section.name: s30
section.heading: Member of Legislative Council deemed to have resigned if appointed to be Chief Executive
section.content: If a Member of the Legislative Council is appointed to be the Chief Executive following his being returned at an election, he is deemed to have signed and given a notice of resignation from office as such Member under section 14 of the Legislative Council Ordinance (Cap. 542) specifying the date of the instrument appointing him to be the Chief Executive as the date on which the notice takes effect.

section.name: s31
section.heading: Winning candidate to declare he is not a member of political party

subsection.leadIn: A person declared under section 28 as elected at an election shall, within 7 working days after the declaration—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: publicly make a statutory declaration to the effect that he is not a member of any political party; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: lodge with the Returning Officer a written undertaking to the effect that he will not, if appointed as the Chief Executive—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: become a member of any political party; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: do any act that has the effect of subjecting himself to the discipline of any political party,

paragraph.continued: during his term of office as the Chief Executive.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a political body or organization (whether operating in Hong Kong or elsewhere) which purports to be a political party; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a body or organization the principal function or main object of which is to promote or prepare a candidate for election as a member of the Legislative Council or any District Council; (Amended 15 of 2016 s. 25)

subsection.def: working day (工作日) has the meaning given by section 2A(1). (Added 15 of 2016 s. 25)

section.name: s32
section.heading: Election may be questioned only by election petition made on specified grounds

subsection.leadIn: An election may be questioned only by an election petition on the ground that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the person declared by the Returning Officer under section 28 as elected was not duly elected because—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: he was not eligible to be nominated as a candidate under section 13;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: he was disqualified under section 14 from being nominated as a candidate;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: he should have been disqualified under section 20(1) from being elected but was not so disqualified;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: he engaged in corrupt conduct or illegal conduct at the election;

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: another person engaged in corrupt conduct or illegal conduct in respect of him at the election in connection with his candidature;

subparagraph.name: vi
subparagraph.content: corrupt conduct or illegal conduct was generally prevalent at the election; or

subparagraph.name: vii
subparagraph.leadIn: material irregularity occurred in relation to—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the election;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: the poll at the election; or

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: the counting of votes in respect of the election; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the candidate declared by the Returning Officer under section 22(1AB)(c) as not returned at the election is not returned because material irregularity occurred in relation to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the election;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the poll at the election; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the counting of votes in respect of the election. (Replaced 10 of 2006 s. 15)

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is to be construed subject to section 9B; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: subject to paragraph (a), includes nomination proceedings and the decisions of the Candidate Eligibility Review Committee, the Returning Officer or any Assistant Returning Officer; (Replaced 14 of 2021 s. 400)

subsection.def: illegal conduct (非法行為) means illegal conduct within the meaning of Part 3 of the Elections (Corrupt and Illegal Conduct) Ordinance (Cap. 554).

section.name: s33
section.heading: Who may lodge election petition

subsection.leadIn: An election petition—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may be lodged by any candidate in the election; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: may be lodged by—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a person who was determined under section 17 to be not validly nominated; or (Amended 14 of 2021 s. 401)

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: a person who was disqualified under section 20(1) from being elected,

paragraph.continued: provided that the election petition is, subject to subsection (4), subscribed to by not less than 10 members of the Election Committee in the manner specified in subsection (2).

subsection.content: An election petition shall set out the names and addresses of and be signed by the members of the Election Committee subscribing to it.
A subscription by a member of the Election Committee to an election petition shall not be withdrawn or revoked by the member.

subsection.leadIn: If a member of the Election Committee is disqualified—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: under section 16(5) from making nomination at an election; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: under section 26 from voting at the poll at an election,

subsection.continued: he shall be disqualified from subscribing to an election petition questioning the election.

section.name: s34
section.heading: Period within which election petition and appeal must be lodged

subsection.content: An election petition questioning an election must be lodged within 7 working days after the day on which the result of the election is declared under section 22(1AB) or 28. (Amended 10 of 2006 s. 16)

Notwithstanding section 24 of the Hong Kong Court of Final Appeal Ordinance (Cap. 484), a notice of a motion for the purposes of an application for leave to appeal to the Court of Final Appeal under section 22(1)(c) of that Ordinance shall be filed within 7 working days after the day on which the relevant judgment of the Court is handed down, and the applicant shall give the opposite party 3 days’ notice of his intended application at any time during the period of 7 working days. (Amended E.R. 1 of 2025)

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

def.name: WorkingDay
def.leadIn: working day (工作日) means any day other than—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a general holiday;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a black rainstorm warning day as defined by section 71(2) of the Interpretation and General Clauses Ordinance (Cap. 1); or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a gale warning day as defined by that section. (Added 15 of 2016 s. 26)

section.name: s35
section.heading: Respondent to election petition
section.leadIn: The following persons may be made a respondent to an election petition—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person whose election is questioned by the petition;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Returning Officer; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if grounds for the petition relate to a decision of the Candidate Eligibility Review Committee—the Candidate Eligibility Review Committee.

section.name: s36
section.heading: Court to have jurisdiction to determine election petition

subsection.content: The Court has the same jurisdiction and the same functions in respect of an election petition as it has in respect of an ordinary cause of action within its jurisdiction.
An election petition shall be tried in open court and, unless the Chief Justice otherwise directs, before one judge.

section.name: s37
section.heading: Determination of election petition

subsection.leadIn: The Court shall determine—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: an election petition questioning an election to which section 26A applies in which the Returning Officer declared under section 22(1AB) that no candidate was returned at the election by ruling that—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the only candidate nominated at the election is duly elected; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: no candidate is returned at the election;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: an election petition questioning an election at which a candidate was declared as elected by ruling that—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the candidate is duly elected; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the candidate is not duly elected. (Replaced 10 of 2006 s. 17)

subsection.content: At the end of the trial of an election petition, the Court shall announce its determination by means of a written judgment.

section.name: s38
section.heading: Acts of person not invalid if ruled not to be elected
section.leadIn: A—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: determination of the Court under section 37(1); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: ruling by the Court or the Court of Final Appeal,

section.continued: that a person who was originally declared as elected at an election was not duly elected does not invalidate acts purporting to have been done by the person as the Chief Executive before the determination or ruling, as the case may be.

section.name: s39
section.heading: Time limit for legal challenges

subsection.leadIn: Notwithstanding any provision in the High Court Ordinance (Cap. 4), no—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: application for leave to apply for judicial review under section 21K of that Ordinance; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: other proceedings,

subsection.continued: which put in issue— (Amended 10 of 2006 s. 18)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: whether a candidate is duly determined to be not returned at an election under section 26A(4); or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: whether the candidate declared under section 28 as elected at an election can lawfully assume the office of the Chief Executive,

subsection.continued: shall be made or commenced more than 30 days after the publication of the declaration under section 22(1AB)(d) or the publication of the result of the election under section 28 unless the leave of the Court has been obtained. (Amended 10 of 2006 s. 18)

subsection.leadIn: The Court may upon application grant the leave to make an application for leave to apply for judicial review or commence proceedings after the expiry of the 30 days referred to in subsection (1) if it is satisfied that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person making the first-mentioned application has used his best endeavours to make the second-mentioned application or commence the proceedings within the 30 days; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: granting the leave applied for is in the interest of justice.

section.name: s40
section.heading: Chief Justice may make rules
section.leadIn: The Chief Justice may make rules to provide for—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the preparation, lodgement, service, trial and withdrawal of election petitions;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: costs in respect of those petitions and provision of security for costs;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the practice and procedure concerning the trial of those petitions;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: circumstances in which an election petition is regarded as having been withdrawn;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: applications under section 39(2); and

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: any other matters for the better carrying out of the objects and purposes of this Part.

section.name: s41
section.heading: Appointment of Returning Officers and assistants

subsection.leadIn: The Electoral Affairs Commission shall appoint—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a permanent judge or non-permanent judge of the Court of Final Appeal within the meaning of the Hong Kong Court of Final Appeal Ordinance (Cap. 484);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a Justice of Appeal within the meaning of the High Court Ordinance (Cap. 4); or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a judge of the Court of First Instance (other than a recorder or a deputy judge of the Court of First Instance),

subsection.continued: to be the Returning Officer.

subsection.content: The Returning Officer has such functions as are conferred or imposed on him by or under this Ordinance.
The Electoral Affairs Commission shall appoint such number of Assistant Returning Officers as appears to the Commission to be necessary to enable an election to be held smoothly.
An Assistant Returning Officer may, with the authority of the Returning Officer, perform the functions of the Returning Officer.
An appointment under subsection (1) or (3) shall be published in the Gazette.

subsection.leadIn: Expenses properly incurred by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Returning Officer in the performance of the Officer’s functions under this Ordinance; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Candidate Eligibility Review Committee in the performance of its functions under this Ordinance,

subsection.continued: are to be a charge on and payable from the general revenue. (Replaced 14 of 2021 s. 403)

section.name: s42
section.heading: Offence to obstruct or hinder electoral officers or Candidate Eligibility Review Committee
section.content: A person who, without reasonable excuse, obstructs or hinders, or interferes with, an electoral officer or the Candidate Eligibility Review Committee in the performance of a function conferred or imposed on the officer or the Committee respectively by or under this Ordinance commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 5.

section.name: s43
section.heading: Electoral Affairs Commission may give direction to electoral officers

subsection.leadIn: The Electoral Affairs Commission may give any direction, either generally or in any particular case, with respect to the performance by an electoral officer of any of his functions under this Ordinance with respect to the holding or conduct of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an election;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the nomination and election of a person or persons to be a member or members of the Election Committee under Parts 3 and 4 of the Schedule; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a subsector election.

subsection.content: A direction given under subsection (1) has no effect to the extent that it is inconsistent with this Ordinance or the Electoral Affairs Commission Ordinance (Cap. 541).
An electoral officer shall, when performing a function under this Ordinance, comply with any direction given under subsection (1) with respect to the performance of the function.

section.name: s44
section.heading: Death or incapacity of electoral officer not to terminate authority
section.content: Death or incapacity of an electoral officer does not terminate any authority conferred by the officer for the purposes of this Ordinance.

section.name: s45
section.heading: Candidates entitled to send letters to members of Election Committee free of postage

subsection.content: Two letters addressed to each member of the Election Committee may be sent free of postage by or on behalf of a candidate.
The cost to the Postmaster General of enabling an entitlement under subsection (1) to be exercised shall be a charge on and payable from the general revenue.

section.name: s46
section.heading: Regulation

subsection.content: The Chief Executive in Council may make regulation for the better carrying out of the purposes of this Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: In particular, the regulation made under subsection (1) may provide for all or any of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the number or qualifications of subscribers required to complete a nomination paper for a candidate at a subsector election;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the amount that a candidate at a subsector election is required to lodge as a deposit at the election;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the forfeiture of the deposit if the candidate at a subsector election fails to obtain a prescribed proportion of the votes cast at the election and for the return of the deposit if he obtains that proportion of votes at the election;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the functions of a Revising Officer;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: appeals to a Revising Officer.

subsection.content: A provision of the regulation made under subsection (1) may make it an offence, punishable by a fine not exceeding level 2, for a person to contravene a provision of the regulation.

subsection.leadIn: A provision of the regulation made under subsection (1) may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: make different provisions for different circumstances and provide for a particular case or class of cases;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be made so as to apply only in specified circumstances; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: prescribe fees for the purposes of the regulation.

section.name: s47
section.heading: Amendment of Schedule
section.content: The Chief Executive in Council may, with the approval of the Legislative Council, amend the Schedule by order published in the Gazette.

section.name: s1
section.heading: Interpretation

subsection.leadIn: In this Schedule—
subsection.def: body (團體) means an incorporated or unincorporated body, and includes a firm or a group of persons (which may include incorporated or unincorporated bodies) who are associated with each other through a shared relevant interest;
corporate member (團體成員), in relation to a body included in a subsector, means a body that is a member of the body so included;
CPPCC member (全國政協委員) means a Hong Kong Special Administrative Region member of the National Committee of the Chinese People’s Political Consultative Conference; (Added 14 of 2021 s. 406)
designated body (指定團體), in relation to a subsector, means a body designated for the subsector in Division 1 of Part 3 for the purposes of section 2(5)(b); (Added 14 of 2021 s. 406)
designated person (指定人士), in relation to a specified person, means a person designated by the specified person under section 5J(3); (Added 14 of 2021 s. 406)
elector (選民), in relation to a functional constituency or geographical constituency, has the meaning assigned to it by section 3(1) of the Legislative Council Ordinance (Cap. 542);

Electoral Registration Officer (選舉登記主任) means the person holding office as Electoral Registration Officer under section 44, and includes any person appointed to act in place of the Officer when the Officer is absent or when the office is vacant;

ex-officio member (當然委員), in relation to the Election Committee, means a person who is registered as an ex-officio member of the Election Committee in, and whose name has not been removed from, the final register of members of the Election Committee; (Added 14 of 2021 s. 406)
geographical constituency (地方選區) means an area declared to be a geographical constituency in accordance with Part 3 of the Legislative Council Ordinance (Cap. 542);

Hong Kong and Kowloon District Committees subsector (港九地區委員會界別分組) means the representatives of members of Area Committees, District Fight Crime Committees, and District Fire Safety Committees of Hong Kong and Kowloon subsector; (Added 14 of 2021 s. 406)
interim register of members of the Election Committee (選舉委員會暫行委員登記冊) means a register published under section 40(1); (Added 10 of 2006 s. 21)

New Territories District Committees subsector (新界地區委員會界別分組) means the representatives of members of Area Committees, District Fight Crime Committees, and District Fire Safety Committees of the New Territories subsector; (Added 14 of 2021 s. 406)

NPC and CPPCC subsector (人大政協界界別分組) means the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region deputies to the National People’s Congress and Hong Kong Special Administrative Region members of the National Committee of the Chinese People’s Political Consultative Conference subsector; (Added 14 of 2021 s. 406)
NPC deputy (全國人大代表) means a Hong Kong Special Administrative Region deputy to the National People’s Congress; (Added 14 of 2021 s. 406)

Returning Officer (選舉主任), in relation to a subsector, means the Returning Officer appointed for the subsector under section 47, and includes any person appointed to act in place of such an Officer when the Officer is absent or when an office of Returning Officer is vacant;

Revising Officer (審裁官) means a Revising Officer appointed under section 46, and includes any person appointed to act in place of the Officer when the Officer is absent or when the office of Revising Officer is vacant;
specified entity (指明實體), in relation to a subsector, means a person or body specified for the subsector in Division 5 of Part 4 for the purposes of section 2(5)(c); (Added 14 of 2021 s. 406)
specified office (指明職位), in relation to a subsector, means an office specified for the subsector in Division 1 of Part 2A for the purposes of section 2(5)(a); (Added 14 of 2021 s. 406)
specified person (指明人士), in relation to a subsector, means a person holding a specified office of the subsector; (Added 14 of 2021 s. 406)

subsector by-election (界別分組補選) means an election to elect a member of the Election Committee assigned to a subsector who, under section 2(7)(c), is to be elected by the relevant subsector, otherwise than at a subsector ordinary election; (Amended 14 of 2021 s. 406)
subsector election (界別分組選舉) means a subsector ordinary election or a subsector by-election;

subsector ordinary election (界別分組一般選舉) means an election to elect those members of the Election Committee assigned to a subsector who, under section 2(7)(c), are to be elected by the relevant subsector, for a new term of office of the Election Committee; (Amended 14 of 2021 s. 406)
the regulations (《規例》) means regulations made under section 46 of this Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Schedule—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the circumstances in which a person has a substantial connection with a body include, but are not limited to, being a member, partner, officer or employee of the body; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the circumstances in which a person has a substantial connection with a subsector include, but are not limited to, being a member, partner, officer or employee of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a body included in the subsector; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a corporate member of a body referred to in subparagraph (i).

subsection.content: In this Schedule, unless otherwise stated, a reference to a Part or section is a reference to a Part or section of this Schedule. (Replaced 14 of 2021 s. 406)

section.name: s1A
section.heading: Effect of inclement weather warning on date and period

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: inclement weather warning day (惡劣天氣警告日) means a working day on which a gale warning or a rainstorm warning is in force at any time during the ordinary business hours of the office of the Electoral Registration Officer;
rainstorm warning (暴雨警告) has the same meaning as in the Judicial Proceedings (Adjournment During Gale Warnings) Ordinance (Cap. 62);
working day (工作日) means any Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday or Friday other than a general holiday.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Electoral Registration Officer is required by section 14 to do an act not later than a date; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the date falls on an inclement weather warning day,

subsection.continued: that section has effect in relation to the act as if it requires the Officer to do the act not later than the next working day, which is not an inclement weather warning day, following the date.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Electoral Registration Officer is required by section 40(3A)(b) to do an act on a date; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the date falls on an inclement weather warning day,

subsection.continued: that section has effect as if it required the Officer to do the act on the next working day which is not an inclement weather warning day, following the date. (Added 15 of 2016 s. 27)

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the last day of the period falls on an inclement weather warning day,

subsection.continued: the period is extended, in relation to the act, to end on the next working day which is not an inclement weather warning day, following the day mentioned in paragraph (b), and that section has effect accordingly. (Added 15 of 2016 s. 27)

section.name: s2
section.heading: How Election Committee is to be constituted

subsection.content: The Election Committee is to consist of 1 500 members, who must be Hong Kong permanent residents. (Amended 1 of 2011 s. 9)
The membership of the Election Committee is to be determined in accordance with the procedures specified in this Schedule.
The members of the Election Committee are to be representative of 5 sectors, with each sector being represented by 300 members. (Amended 1 of 2011 s. 9)
The sectors are to be composed of the subsectors specified in Tables 1, 2, 3, 4 and 5.

subsection.leadIn: Each subsector is to be composed of—

paragraph.name: a
b
c
paragraph.content: if the number specified in column 5 of the relevant Table opposite to that subsector is not 0—the specified entities of that subsector. (Replaced 14 of 2021 s. 407)

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (7), for the purpose of constituting the Election Committee, each subsector is allocated the number of members specified in columns 3, 4 and 5 of the relevant Table in respect of the subsector.

subsection.leadIn: The Election Committee is constituted in the following manner—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subject to subsection (8), in relation to a subsector specified in column 2 of a Table, the number specified in column 3 of the Table opposite to the subsector is the number of members to be filled by the persons registered in accordance with Part 2A as ex-officio members of the subsector;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to a subsector specified in column 2 of a Table, the number specified in column 4 of the Table opposite to the subsector is the number of members to be nominated by the designated bodies of the subsector in accordance with Part 3;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: subject to subsection (8), in relation to a subsector specified in column 2 of a Table, the number specified in column 5 of the Table opposite to the subsector is the number of members to be elected by the specified entities of the subsector in accordance with Part 4. (Replaced 14 of 2021 s. 407)

subsection.leadIn: Despite subsection (7), for the purpose of constituting a new term of office of the Election Committee, if 1 NPC deputy or CPPCC member chooses, in accordance with section 5I(4), to be registered as a member of a subsector (relevant subsector) other than the NPC and CPPCC subsector, and the registration is determined as valid under section 5N—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the number of members to be filled in relation to the relevant subsector under subsection (7)(a) is to be increased by 1 for that term of office; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the number of members to be elected by the relevant subsector under subsection (7)(c) is to be decreased by 1 for that term of office. (Replaced 14 of 2021 s. 407)

subsection.leadIn: For the purpose of constituting a new term of office of the Election Committee, the Chief Electoral Officer must publish a notice in the Gazette in accordance with the EAC Regulations declaring—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the number of members to be elected by each subsector in accordance with Part 4 for that term of office. (Replaced 14 of 2021 s. 407)

subsection.content: To avoid doubt, the numbers declared under subsection (9) must remain unchanged for that term of office of the Election Committee. (Added 14 of 2021 s. 407)
