section.name: s3
section.heading: Resignation of member of Election Committee

subsection.leadIn: If a person is registered as an ex-officio member of the Election Committee by virtue of holding a specified office, and the person ceases to hold the specified office, the person is regarded as having resigned from the membership of the Election Committee, unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the cessation is due to the expiry of the person’s term of office as the holder of the specified office; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person holds the specified office immediately after the cessation. (Replaced 14 of 2021 s. 408)

subsection.name: 1AA
subsection.leadIn: If a designated person of a specified person is registered as an ex-officio member of the Election Committee, and the specified person ceases to hold a specified office, the designated person is regarded as having resigned from the membership of the Election Committee, unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the cessation is due to the expiry of the specified person’s term of office as the holder of the specified office; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the specified person holds the specified office immediately after the cessation. (Added 14 of 2021 s. 408)

subsection.name: 1AAB
subsection.leadIn: If a person (registered member) is registered as an ex-officio member of the Election Committee under section 5J(4) because a specified person is not eligible to be so registered, and the specified person ceases to hold the specified office concerned, the registered member is regarded as having resigned from the membership of the Election Committee, unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the cessation is due to the expiry of the specified person’s term of office as the holder of the specified office; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the specified person holds the specified office immediately after the cessation. (Added 14 of 2021 s. 408)

subsection.name: 1AAC
subsection.leadIn: If a person is registered as an ex-officio member of the Election Committee under section 5J(3) or (4), and the person ceases to hold an office in, or the office of Council Chairman or the office of Chairman of the Board of Governors (as the case may be) in, the relevant body (as defined by section 5J(6)) concerned, the person is regarded as having resigned from the membership of the Election Committee, unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the cessation is due to the expiry of the person’s term of office as the holder of the office concerned; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person holds the office immediately after the cessation. (Added 14 of 2021 s. 408)

subsection.name: 1AAD
subsection.leadIn: If a person is nominated as a member of the Election Committee representing the accountancy subsector under section 7, and the person ceases to be a Hong Kong Accounting Advisor appointed by the Ministry of Finance of the People’s Republic of China, the person is regarded as having resigned from the membership of the Election Committee, unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the cessation is due to the expiry of the person’s term of office as a Hong Kong Accounting Advisor; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person is a Hong Kong Accounting Advisor immediately after the cessation. (Added 14 of 2021 s. 408)

subsection.name: 1AAE
subsection.leadIn: If a person is nominated as a member of the Election Committee representing the Chinese medicine subsector under section 7, and the person ceases to be a Hong Kong member of the Council of the World Federation of Chinese Medicine Societies, the person is regarded as having resigned from the membership of the Election Committee, unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the cessation is due to the expiry of the person’s term of office as the member of the Council of the Federation; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person is a member of the Council of the Federation immediately after the cessation. (Added 14 of 2021 s. 408)

subsection.name: 1AAF
subsection.leadIn: If a person is nominated as a member of the Election Committee representing the legal subsector under section 7, and the person ceases to be a Hong Kong member of the Council of the China Law Society, the person is regarded as having resigned from the membership of the Election Committee, unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the cessation is due to the expiry of the person’s term of office as the member of the Council of the Society; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person is a member of the Council of the Society immediately after the cessation. (Added 14 of 2021 s. 408)

subsection.name: 1AAG
subsection.content: If a person is nominated as a member of the Election Committee representing the technology and innovation subsector under section 7, and the person ceases to be a Hong Kong academician of the Chinese Academy of Sciences or the Chinese Academy of Engineering, the person is regarded as having resigned from the membership of the Election Committee. (Added 14 of 2021 s. 408)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn: If a member of the Election Committee representing the Heung Yee Kuk subsector ceases to be the Chairman or a Vice-Chairman of the Heung Yee Kuk or a Councillor of the Full Council of the Heung Yee Kuk, he is deemed to have resigned from the membership of the Election Committee unless— (Amended 14 of 2021 s. 408)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the cessation is due to the expiry of his term of office as the Chairman or a Vice-Chairman of the Heung Yee Kuk or a Councillor of the Full Council of the Heung Yee Kuk (as the case may be); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: he is the Chairman or a Vice-Chairman of the Heung Yee Kuk or a Councillor of the Full Council of the Heung Yee Kuk immediately after the cessation. (Added 10 of 2006 s. 6)

subsection.name: 1B
subsection.leadIn: If a member of the Election Committee representing the Hong Kong and Kowloon District Committees subsector ceases to be a member of an Area Committee, District Fight Crime Committee or District Fire Safety Committee in a District mentioned in section 39ZH (specified Committee), the member is regarded as having resigned from the membership of the Election Committee, unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the cessation is due to the expiry of the member’s term of office as a member of the specified Committee; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the member is a member of the specified Committee immediately after the cessation. (Replaced 14 of 2021 s. 408)

subsection.name: 1C
subsection.leadIn: If a member of the Election Committee representing the New Territories District Committees subsector ceases to be a member of an Area Committee, District Fight Crime Committee or District Fire Safety Committee in a District mentioned in section 39ZI (specified Committee), the member is regarded as having resigned from the membership of the Election Committee, unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the cessation is due to the expiry of the member’s term of office as a member of the specified Committee; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the member is a member of the specified Committee immediately after the cessation. (Replaced 14 of 2021 s. 408)

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person is a member of the Election Committee (other than an ex-officio member); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Electoral Registration Officer, by adding the person’s name to the final register of members of the Election Committee, registers the person as an ex-officio member of the Committee under section 41(3),

subsection.continued: the person is deemed to have resigned, on the date on which the person’s name is so added, from the membership referred to in paragraph (a). (Amended 14 of 2021 s. 408)

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: after a designated person is registered as an ex-officio member of the Election Committee, the person becomes a holder of a specified office; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Electoral Registration Officer, by adding the person’s name to the final register of members of the Election Committee, registers the person as an ex-officio member of the Committee under section 41(3) by reason of the person being the holder of the specified office,

subsection.continued: the person is regarded as having resigned, on the date on which the person’s name is so added, from the membership referred to in paragraph (a). (Added 14 of 2021 s. 408)

subsection.content: A member of the Election Committee (other than an ex-officio member) may resign from the membership by giving written notice of resignation to the Electoral Registration Officer.
A notice of resignation is not effective unless it is signed by the member concerned.

subsection.leadIn: A notice of resignation takes effect—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on the date on which the notice is received by the Electoral Registration Officer; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if a later date is specified in the notice, on that later date.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Electoral Registration Officer to compile and publish provisional register

subsection.leadIn: The Electoral Registration Officer must compile and publish in accordance with the EAC Regulations a provisional register of members of the Election Committee—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: during the period beginning on the date of the making of a vacancy declaration and ending on 14 days after that date; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: during the period beginning on the date falling 210 days before the specified date and ending on the date falling 165 days before the specified date. (Replaced 14 of 2021 s. 409)

subsection.leadIn: The Electoral Registration Officer is not required to compile and publish a provisional register of members of the Election Committee under subsection (1) if— (Amended 10 of 2006 s. 31)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a provisional register of members of the Election Committee was published within 12 months before the first day of the period referred to in subsection (1)(a) or (b); (Replaced 14 of 2021 s. 409)

paragraph.name: ab
paragraph.content: the Election Committee was constituted within 12 months before the first day of the period referred to in subsection (1)(a) or (b); (Added 14 of 2021 s. 409)

paragraph.name: ac
paragraph.content: the Legislative Council is dissolved during its current term of office by the Chief Executive in accordance with the Basic Law; or (Added 14 of 2021 s. 409)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the election to fill the vacancy referred to in the vacancy declaration is to be held on a date that falls outside the term of office of the Election Committee.

subsection.content: A provisional register of members of the Election Committee is to be based on the existing final register of members of the Election Committee.

subsection.leadIn: In compiling a provisional register of members of the Election Committee, the Electoral Registration Officer shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: after scrutinizing the existing final register of members of the Election Committee, strike out the names and other relevant particulars of those persons (other than ex-officio members) whom the Electoral Registration Officer is satisfied on reasonable grounds as, on the date of the making of the relevant vacancy declaration or on the date that is 14 days before the date of notice in the Gazette of publication of the provisional register of members of the Election Committee (whichever is earlier)— (Amended 10 of 2006 s. 31; 8 of 2025 s. 35)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: being dead;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: having resigned, or being deemed to have resigned, from the Election Committee under section 3; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: having ceased to be registered or eligible to be registered, or having been disqualified from being registered, under the Legislative Council Ordinance (Cap. 542) as an elector for a geographical constituency; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: enter the names and other relevant particulars of those persons on an omissions list.

subsection.leadIn: As soon as practicable after complying with subsection (4), the Electoral Registration Officer shall publish—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the Gazette; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in such other publications (if any) as are prescribed by the EAC Regulations,

subsection.continued: a notice to the effect that the names and other relevant particulars of persons who are no longer eligible to have their names included in the final register of members of the Election Committee have been entered on an omissions list and specifying the times and the place at which a copy of the omissions list may be inspected. (Amended 14 of 2021 s. 409)

subsection.leadIn: The Electoral Registration Officer shall, for the period prescribed for the purposes of this subsection by the EAC Regulations—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: keep a copy of the omissions list at that Officer’s office; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: during the ordinary business hours of that office, make that copy available for inspection in accordance with the EAC Regulations. (Amended 14 of 2021 s. 409)

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: existing final register of members of the Election Committee (現有選舉委員會正式委員登記冊) means the final register of members of the Election Committee that is in effect under section 43 on the first day of the period referred to in subsection (1)(a) or (b) (as the case may be); (Replaced 10 of 2006 s. 31. Amended 14 of 2021 s. 409)
specified date (指明日期) means the date on which the current term of office of the Legislative Council is to end; (Added 14 of 2021 s. 409)
vacancy declaration (空缺宣布) means a declaration under section 5 of this Ordinance. (Replaced 25 of 2003 s. 56)

section.name: s5
section.heading: Supplementary nomination or subsector by-election to be held to fill vacancy in membership of Election Committee

subsection.leadIn: As soon as practicable after the Electoral Registration Officer has published a provisional register of members of the Election Committee, the Electoral Affairs Commission—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must ascertain the number of members nominated in accordance with Part 3 or elected in accordance with Part 4 for each subsector on the Election Committee; and (Replaced 14 of 2021 s. 410)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the number of members so ascertained as representing a subsector is less than the number of members allocated to the subsector in accordance with section 2(7)(b) or (c), must, in accordance with the EAC Regulations, arrange for a supplementary nomination or a subsector by-election (as the case may be) to be held to fill the vacancy among the members representing the subsector on the Election Committee. (Replaced 14 of 2021 s. 410)

subsection.leadIn: When making an ascertainment under subsection (1)(a), the Electoral Affairs Commission shall have regard to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the provisional register of members of the Election Committee; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the determinations of the Revising Officer on the appeals, if any, made under section 48 in relation to the register. (Amended 14 of 2021 s. 410)

section.name: s5I
section.heading: Registration of NPC deputies and CPPCC members as ex-officio members

subsection.content: An NPC deputy or a CPPCC member may be registered as an ex-officio member, but only if the deputy or member is registered in accordance with this section and the EAC Regulations.

If an NPC deputy or a CPPCC member is holding a specified office of a subsector (specified subsector) other than the NPC and CPPCC subsector, the deputy or member may only be registered as an ex-officio member of the specified subsector.

subsection.leadIn: To avoid doubt, if the NPC deputy or CPPCC member holds 2 or more specified offices of one or more specified subsectors—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: section 5J(3) or (4) (as appropriate) applies in relation to the other specified office or offices for the purpose of making a designation or registration.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (2), an NPC deputy or a CPPCC member may choose to be registered as an ex-officio member of a subsector as defined by section 11(1) (relevant subsector) if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the total number of NPC deputies and CPPCC members who—

subparagraph.content: are eligible to be registered as ex-officio members under section 5L;
are not disqualified from being registered as ex-officio members under section 5M; and
do not fall within subsection (2),

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the deputy or member has substantial connection with the relevant subsector.

subsection.leadIn: For subsection (4)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the number of NPC deputy or CPPCC member who chooses to be registered as an ex-officio member of a relevant subsector must not exceed the number specified in column 5 of the Table concerned in section 2 opposite to the relevant subsector; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the total number of NPC deputies and CPPCC members who choose to be registered as ex-officio members of the relevant subsectors must not exceed the difference between the specified number and the total number referred to in subsection (4)(a).

subsection.content: If, after the publication of the final register of members of the Election Committee for a term of office of the Election Committee under section 40(3A), an NPC deputy or a CPPCC member registered as an ex-officio member of a subsector resigns or is regarded as having resigned under section 3, a subsequently appointed NPC deputy or CPPCC member may only be registered as an ex-officio member of that subsector for that term of office of the Election Committee.
An NPC deputy or a CPPCC member may only be registered as an ex-officio member of a subsector under subsection (6) if the deputy or member has substantial connection with the subsector.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: specified number (指明數目) means the number specified in column 3 of Table 5 in section 2 opposite to the NPC and CPPCC subsector.

section.name: s5J
section.heading: Registration of other specified persons and designated persons as ex-officio members

subsection.content: Subject to section 5I, a specified person or a designated person of the specified person may be registered as an ex-officio member, but only if the specified person submits a registration form to the Electoral Registration Officer in accordance with this section and the EAC Regulations.
If a specified person holds more than one specified office, the person may only choose to be registered as an ex-officio member as the holder of one of the specified offices.

subsection.leadIn: A specified person holding a specified office of an applicable subsector may designate another person who is holding an office in a relevant body in relation to the specified office to be registered as an ex-officio member if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the specified person is not eligible to be registered as an ex-officio member under section 5L; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the specified person is a holder of more than one specified office (excluding the office of NPC deputy or CPPCC member).

subsection.leadIn: If a holder of a specified office set out in section 5B(a), (b), (c), (d), (e), (f), (g), (h), (i), (j) or (k) is not eligible to be registered as an ex-officio member under section 5L—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: in relation to a specified office set out in section 5B(b), (c), (d), (e), (f), (g), (h) or (i)—the Council Chairman of a relevant body in relation to the specified office; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in relation to a specified office set out in section 5B(j) or (k)—the Chairman of the Board of Governors of a relevant body in relation to the specified office,

subsection.continued: is to be regarded as a specified office of the relevant body.

subsection.leadIn: To avoid doubt, for the purposes of subsection (3)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the specified person holds more than 2 specified offices of one or more applicable subsectors, the person may designate different persons to be registered as ex-officio members for different specified offices; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a designated person may only be registered as an ex-officio member for 1 specified office.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

def.name: ApplicableSubsector
def.leadIn: applicable subsector (適用界別分組) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the architectural, surveying, planning and landscape subsector;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the engineering subsector;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the medical and health services subsector; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the social welfare subsector;

subsection.def: relevant body (相關團體), in relation to a specified office set out in a paragraph of a section in Division 1, means the body described in the paragraph.

section.name: s5K
section.heading: Validity of registration contingent on declaration
section.leadIn: A registration of a person as an ex-officio member under section 5I or 5J is not valid unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the registration form contains a declaration to the effect that the person will uphold the Basic Law and pledge allegiance to the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region of the People’s Republic of China; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the declaration is signed by the person.

section.name: s5L
section.heading: Who is eligible to be registered as an ex-officio member

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (2), a person is eligible to be registered as an ex-officio member of a subsector under section 5I or 5J if the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is eligible to be registered as an elector under Part 5 of the Legislative Council Ordinance (Cap. 542) for a geographical constituency and has made an application to be so registered, or is registered in the existing geographical constituencies final register (as defined by section 11(1)) and is eligible to be, and is not disqualified from being, registered as an elector for a geographical constituency; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is holding a specified office of the subsector.

subsection.content: Subsection (1)(b) does not apply to a person to be registered as an ex-officio member under section 5J(3).

subsection.leadIn: However, a person is not eligible to be registered as an ex-officio member if the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is a principal official appointed pursuant to a nomination under Article 48(5) of the Basic Law;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is a directorate officer of the Government;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: is an Administrative Officer of the Government;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: is an Information Officer of the Government;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: is a police officer; or

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: is any other civil servant who is holding an office specified in Division 1 in his or her official capacity.

section.name: s5M
section.heading: When a person is disqualified from being registered as an ex-officio member

subsection.leadIn: A person is disqualified from being registered as an ex-officio member if the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: has in Hong Kong or in any other place been sentenced to death or imprisonment (by whatever name called) and has not either—

subparagraph.content: received a free pardon;

paragraph.name: ab
b
paragraph.content: on the date of submission of the registration form, is serving a sentence of imprisonment;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: without limiting paragraph (a), where the registration form is submitted within 5 years after the date of the person’s conviction, is or has been convicted—

subparagraph.content: of an offence against Part II of the Prevention of Bribery Ordinance (Cap. 201); or
of any offence prescribed by section 7 of Schedule 4A to the District Councils Ordinance (Cap. 547) or the EAC Regulations; (Amended 19 of 2023 s. 188)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: is found for the time being under the Mental Health Ordinance (Cap. 136) to be incapable, by reason of mental incapacity, of managing and administering his or her property and affairs; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: is a member of the armed forces of the People’s Republic of China or any other country or territory.

subsection.leadIn: Without prejudice to section 13(1)(c) of the Electoral Affairs Commission Ordinance (Cap. 541), a person is also disqualified from being registered as an ex-officio member if, within the 5 years before the date of submission of the registration form—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person has vacated an office, or has been disqualified from entering on an office, under the law, for declining or neglecting to take a specified oath; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the person has been declared or decided in accordance with any law—

subparagraph.content: to be in breach of a specified oath; or
to have failed to fulfil the legal requirements and conditions on upholding the Basic Law and bearing allegiance to the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region of the People’s Republic of China.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: specified oath (指明誓言) means an oath taken under the law that the oath-taker will uphold the Basic Law and bear allegiance to the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region of the People’s Republic of China.

section.name: s5N
section.heading: Determination of validity of registration
section.content: The Candidate Eligibility Review Committee must, as soon as practicable after a registration form that complies with this Part and the EAC Regulations is submitted in accordance with those Regulations, determine whether or not the proposed registration is valid in accordance with Annex I to the Basic Law and this Ordinance.

section.name: s5O
section.heading: Application of the Elections (Corrupt and Illegal Conduct) Ordinance
section.content: The Elections (Corrupt and Illegal Conduct) Ordinance (Cap. 554) applies, with any necessary modifications, to and in relation to the registration and designation of persons to be ex-officio members of the Election Committee under section 5I or 5J in the same way as it applies to and in relation to a subsector election and so applies as if the persons to be registered were candidates at a subsector election.

section.name: s5P
section.heading: Designated body of the accountancy subsector
section.content: The designated body of the accountancy subsector is Association of Hong Kong Accounting Advisors Limited.

section.name: s5Q
section.heading: Designated body of the Chinese medicine subsector
section.content: The designated body of the Chinese medicine subsector is WFCMS (Hong Kong) Council Members Association Limited.

section.name: s5R
section.heading: Designated body of the legal subsector
section.content: The designated body of the legal subsector is China Law Society’s HK Council Members Association.

section.name: s5S
section.heading: Designated bodies of the sports, performing arts, culture and publication subsector
section.leadIn: The designated bodies of the sports, performing arts, culture and publication subsector are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: Sports Federation & Olympic Committee of Hong Kong, China;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: China Federation of Literary and Art Circles Hong Kong Member Association Limited; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: Hong Kong Publishing Federation Limited.

section.name: s5T
section.heading: Designated body of the technology and innovation subsector
section.content: The designated body of the technology and innovation subsector is The Greater Bay Area Association of Academicians.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Designated bodies of the religious subsector

paragraph.name: e

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: The Hong Kong Buddhist Association.

section.name: s6A
section.heading: Designated bodies of the representatives of associations of Hong Kong residents in the Mainland subsector
section.leadIn: The designated bodies of the representatives of associations of Hong Kong residents in the Mainland subsector are—

paragraph.name: b

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: Mainland China (Zhongshan) Consultant Services Centre, The Hong Kong Federation of Trade Unions;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: Mainland China (Huizhou) Consultant Services Centre, The Hong Kong Federation of Trade Unions;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: Mainland China (Fujian, Xiamen) Consultant Services Centre, The Hong Kong Federation of Trade Unions;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: Hong Kong Chamber of Commerce in China;

paragraph.name: h

Hong Kong Chamber of Commerce in China—Shanghai;

paragraph.name: j

Hong Kong Chamber of Commerce in China—Fujian;

paragraph.name: r

Hong Kong Chamber of Commerce, Qianhai, Shenzhen;

Fujian Federation of Overseas Chinese Entrepreneurs;

paragraph.name: za
